abstract.p: Kelefa Sanneh lists and comments on his choices for top 10 pop albums of 2004; photos (M)

block.p: 1. KANYE WEST, 'THE COLLEGE DROPOUT' (Roc-a-Fella/Island Def Jam) On his classic debut album, this mischievous rapper-producer doesn't hide his excitement: he sings along to his own spliced-soul beats, thrills to his own tall tales of triumph and disappointment, chuckles at his own endless supply of shameless jokes. There's only one sensible response: Join him.

2. GRETCHEN WILSON, 'HERE FOR THE PARTY' (Epic/Sony Nashville) Ms. Wilson's debut album is packed with playful Southern rock, including the rowdy breakthrough hit ''Redneck Woman.'' But the ballads are even better, especially ''When I Think About Cheatin','' a paradoxical love song (contemplating infidelity never sounded so romantic) that's already a country classic.

3. CAM'RON, 'PURPLE HAZE' (Roc-a-Fella/Island Def Jam) A rapper who is meaner, weirder and smarter than the competition. Over beats both wistful and menacing, Cam'ron turns blunt threats into jabberwockian verse (''Rap with the rappers/Scrap with the actors/Cap back, abracadabra''), losing himself in the language of power and the power of language.

4. JOANNA NEWSOM, 'THE MILK-EYED MENDER' (Drag City) This extraordinary harpist has a glorious, untamed voice and a sheaf of tricky song-poems. Ms. Newsom wraps her puns and pleas in shimmering, kora-inspired harp figures, conjuring one startlingly vivid image after another: ''Across the sky sheet the impossible birds/In a steady, illiterate movement homewards.''

5. MODEST MOUSE, 'GOOD NEWS FOR PEOPLE WHO LOVE BAD NEWS' (Sony) Modest Mouse once seemed too ornery to make an album this lovable. ''As life gets longer, awful feels softer/And it feels pretty soft to me,'' Isaac Brock sings, and his band makes a joyful noise, from clattering folk-punk to sleek new wave.

6. DADDY YANKEE, 'BARRIO FINO' (VI/Universal) On this restless and ferocious CD, Daddy Yankee spits rapid-fire rhymes to match his machine-gun beats. He's one of the biggest stars in Puerto Rico's booming reggaeton scene, and in his swaggering party tracks you can hear a whole universe of music, from salsa to techno.

7. THE ARCADE FIRE, 'FUNERAL' (Merge) A grand, passionate indie-rock debut from Montreal. The music surges and retreats, buoyed by swelling strings and full-throated choirs, while RÃ©gine Chassagne and her husband, Win Butler, sing of freak snowstorms and ruined families and other not-quite-natural disasters.

8. CRIME MOB, 'CRIME MOB' (BME/Reprise) The year's best crunk album comes from these hyper-rowdy Georgia teenagers (four boys, two girls). Over tinkling, minor-key synthesizers and hard-knocking beats, they gleefully hurl abuse at anyone stupid enough to come to the club looking for a good time: why dance when you can fight?

9. 'BONNIE ''PRINCE'' BILLY SINGS GREATEST PALACE MUSIC' (Drag City) On this sly and lovely CD, Will Oldham convenes an A-list band to Nashville-ize his ''greatest'' nonhits. It's a funny idea but it's not a joke, and after the extreme makeover (supple pedal steel, plaintive fiddle, Marty Slayton's lovely descants), it's even easier to hear the warm, weird glow of these songs.

10. ADA, 'BLONDIE' (Areal/Kompakt) Ada is a singer-producer from Cologne, Germany, the epicenter of electronic minimalism. And yet the meticulous (and danceable) computer compositions on ''Blondie'' find ways to gesture toward pop. The most obvious gesture: ''Maps,'' her whispery, intoxicating cover of last year's Yeah Yeah Yeahs hit.

And singles: 1. CIARA FEATURING LIL JON AND PETEY PABLO, 'GOODIES' (LaFace); 2. USHER FEATURING LIL JON, 'YEAH!' (Arista/BMG); 3. JULIE ROBERTS, 'BREAK DOWN HERE' (Mercury/Nashville); 4. BRITNEY SPEARS, 'TOXIC' (Jive); 5. LIL SCRAPPY, 'NO PROBLEM' (Reprise); 6. M.I.A., 'GALANG' (XL); 7. AKON FEATURING STYLES P, 'LOCKED UP (REMIX)' (SRC/Universal); 8. MARIO WINANS FEATURING ENYA, 'I DON'T WANNA KNOW' (Bad Boy/Universal); 9. SNOOP DOGG, 'DROP IT LIKE IT'S HOT' (Geffen/Universal); 10. LORETTA LYNN FEATURING JACK WHITE, 'PORTLAND OREGON' (Interscope/Universal)
